app.activationHint1: Before you activate the app, please completa all actions in the todo list below.
app.activationHint2: Note: To avoid conflicting settings you should carefully make sure no external flows are working against this app before before activating it.
app.maxPowHint: The maximum power can also be changed with flows for example when different maximums are wanted during winter and summer time.

carChargerHint: Electric car charging is under development - there is no guarantee that this will work yet - (Work is being done on providing direct integration with the Easee electric car charger - this requires you to run a test version of the Easee app as version 1.4.9 has not been rolled out yet).

-->

Other chargers are also being tested but have to be controlled by flow cards. More info will come here when this has been tested and verified.
chargeTargetHint: Supported chargers are controlled by the app automatically provided they are added as a controllable device. For unsupported chargers you can either use flow cards or send a device report.

-->

Please note that chargers listed under ignored devices must be managed via flows.

-->

To control via flows, you must connect to the following triggers in the app: 'Start charging' and 'Stop charging', while 'Change charging power' is optional but reccomended.

-->

In order to start the charging process you must call the flow card action 'Start charging cycle'.
charge.chargeMinHint: The minimum charging current indicates the charging power your charger uses when you switch it on. If the charger only has one setting, enter it here. If the charger can control the current, enter the minimum power it can draw.
charge.chargeThresholdHint: A new charging cycle only starts when the idle power exceeds the threshold value set here. This should be slightly more than the minimum charging current to avoid the charger switching off again straight away.
charge.minToggleTimeHint: This value indicates in seconds how long it is between each time a signal is sent to the charger. If the response time of the charger exceeds this value, this value should be increased accordingly.
charge.chargeRemainingHint: This value shows how much power will be offered to the charger before the app stops charging. This energy will be distributed over all the remaining time until the end of the charging cycle. You cannot set this value here, it must be set from the 'Start charge cycle' flowchart.
charge.chargeEndHint: This field shows when the current charging cycle will end. You cannot set this value here, it must be set from the 'Start charge cycle' flowchart.

global.errorMarginHint1: Ensure that you always end up a bit below the effect tariff.
global.errorMarginHint2: Hint: This give you room for a minor overuse another day as the tariff is based on a 3 day average.
global.safetyPowerHint1: Avoid failing the power target by reserving power to uncontrollable devices.
global.safetyPowerHint2: Hint: You can use flow cards to change the reserved power during the day. It is reccomended to reserve more power before making dinner.
global.mainFuseHint: The main fuse is important for what is calculated as the maximum available power. The app will not let you use more power than the main fuse allows.
global.freeThresholdHint: Free power will only be reported if the indicated amount of controllable units are switched on. This can be used to give priority to devices that are controlled outside the app, such as charging an electric car. 0% will give the highest priority while 100% will give the lowest priority.
global.deviceListHint1: Only selected devices can be controlled by the app. If your device is not listed then follow the instructions in the Help panel.
global.deviceListHint2: Tip: For optimal control, ensure that heavy adjustable current draws are set to a power that does not exceed the desired power tariff. Otherwise it will result in frequent switching on/off.

cost.gridLimitHint: If you configure the cost per capacity step according to your grid provider, then your montly savings will be correctly calculated.

help.notFoundHint: Unfortunately, there are some devices that do not use the standard mechanisms to be controlled. These will therefore not be detected as controllable by this app. Luckilly this can be easilly supported, just click the link below, generate a report and send the log to the developer.
help.supportedDevicesHint: If your device is not listed, please follow the instructions here:
aboutInfoHint: This app was made in order for everyone to control their energy usage in a simple way and at the same time save as much money as possible on it.

-->

A lot of free time has gone into developing this app. If you're hgappy with what you save then please feel free to support the development of the app in the following ways: (completely optional)

-->

You can sponsor the development of the app by donating money at https://github.com/sponsors/frodeheg

-->

This page takes a few seconds to load, therefore a loading screen has been added to inform about the waiting time. This can be a good advertising space, as there is a waiting period that you cannot avoid.

price.priceKindHint:
The option 'External' retrieves the price from the app 'Norwegian Electricity Bill' if it is installed.

'Spot price' is retrieved from the European electricity exchange.

'Fixed price' allows you to enter a fixed price per kWh. The total price will still vary throghout the day due to grid cost.

buttons.help: Frost guard and zone control will override all actions. Frost guard will override everything with a thermostat and zone control turns off everything without frost guard. Other than that the actions have the following effect
buttons.helpOn: On when sufficient power, otherwize off
buttons.helpDelta: Turn on and change temp, but only if sufficient power
buttons.helpEmergency: Turn off only as a last resort to get below the power tariff (no frost guard)
buttons.helpIgnore: Ignore the unit completely (no frost guard)

price.actionDirtCheap: Actions when price is dirt cheap
price.actionExtreme: Actions when price is extremely high
priceHint1: The Mode allows you to choose whether to feed the app with manually crafted price points or if the price points should be set automatically. If neither is used (deactivated) then the app will only control max power.

-->

Manual control from flow cards give you greatest flexibility but leave all the responsibility to interpret the electricity price to you.

-->

Automatic interprets the prices according to the preferences set in the app.
price.priceErr1: Note! You have to install the app 'Norwegian Electricity Bill' and acompanying device for external prices to be fetched. The prices are fetched seamlessly, flow cards are not necessary.
price.pricePointHint: The behaviour of each price point is defined below. Price points can be changed by using flows.

internal.minCheapTimeHint: Regardless of the actual price, you can demand that the x cheapest hours of the day always set the price point to cheap.
internal.minExpensiveTimeHint: Regardless of the actual price, you can demand that the x most expensive hours of the day should always set the price point to expensive.
internal.dirtCheapPriceModifierHint: If the current hourly price falls x% below the basis for price comparison, the price point is always set to Dirt cheap
internal.lowPriceModifierHint: If the current hourly price falls x% below the basis for price comparison, the price point is always set to Low
internal.highPriceModifierHint: If the current hourly price is x% above the basis for price comparison, the price point is always set to High
internal.extremePriceModifierHint: If the current hourly price is x% above the basis for price comparison, the price point is always set to Extremely High
internal.averageTimeHint: Whether a price is expensive or cheap is determined by seeing if it is x% above/below the average price in the specified interval.

frost.frostHint: If the temperature for one unit falls below the minimum allowed temperature then the unit will be turned on independent of any other power control.

zone.zoneHint: The purpose of zones is to completely disable all heating/cooling sources in a zone if doors or windows are open. You don't have to care about zones if you do not have door and window sensors.
zone.zoneHint2: You have to use flows to turn zones off and on again.
zone.zonesOff: The following zones has been forced off

mode.operatingModeHint: Hint: You can use flow cards to change operating mode.
mode.priorityHint1: In case of excessive power consumption, the app starts turning off devices from the bottom of the list. Devices at the top of the list will be the last to be turned off.
mode.priorityHint2: When the desired power tariff is within reach, the app will start turning on devices again.
mode.priorityHint3: In order to prevent frequent switching on/off, the app will insert a waiting time after the last switch-off before appliances are switched on again. Therefore, set power consumption for electric car chargers roughly equal to the desired power tariff and low priority.

newdevice.info: This device will give you insight into what happens when the app controls the flow. There is no need to install this device to make the app work.
newdevice.info2: As the device only works as a window into the app, you cannot therefore configure what happens through this device's settings. You can only configure what happens through the app's settings.
